oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lyolurninescence and ESR correlation studies of trehalose dihydrate
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAMAN, A
OOMMEN, IK
RAO, TKG
SHARMA, DN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lyoluminescence characteristics
dosimetry
lactose
tris
lyoluminescence
esr
disaccharide
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: ESR studies of irradiated lyloluminescence (LL) phosphor, trehalose dihydrate showed a linear free radical growth up to a dose of 11 kGy. The LL output measured under oxygen equilibrated conditions showed an extension of the dosimetric response from 0.6 to 6 kGy. ESR spectral analysis indicates the formation of two radical species viz.. 'a' and 'b' and their involvement in the LL process. The estimated free radical concentrations of radicals 'a' and 'b' were found to be 6.81 x 10(15) and 1.35 x 10(16) g(-1), respectively, for a gamma dose of 10.8 kGy. (C) 2002 . .
